properties.description: Posted by Templetonl9 girls in one house for 2 years - more stories than I could possibly remember have come from this house: family dinners, gift exchanges, silly pranks, dance parties, work-out videos, long talks, serenades, the list coule go on. These 2 years were a couple of the best in my life\'s story. We\'re all over the world now: some married, some teaching, some serving Jesus in other countries and here in the US. The Lighthouse brewed some quality girls.

Posted by TempletonlMy first Christmas away from home was spent, not in downtown London, but in Stafford, in the outskirts of London. Of course on Christmas the Underground was closed, and we were just far away from everything to need the public transportation. Christy and I were stuck in our hostel on Christmas Day taking naps, eating pizza, and trading music.

Posted by TempletonlOh Bristol. My "home" for a few months in the winter of 2005. I taught with some wonderful teachers who often fought for their students in the midst of a horrible setting and difficult population. God grew my character more in these few months than in any other single time in my life (maybe with the exception of YWAM).

properties.name: Art Festival
properties.description: Posted by TempletonlÂ Every September my sister and I go to an Art Festival in downtown Noblesville. I usually can\'t buy anything because I\'m poor, but I look at to look at everything.

properties.name: Baby Blue
properties.description: Posted by TempletonlThe Summer or \'02....working for the mafia under the auspices of a lifeguard. Too many stories and memories have come out of that summer.

properties.name: Fishponds, Bristol

I taught with some wonderful teachers who often fought for their students in the midst of a horrible setting and difficult population. properties.name: My Favorite Store
properties.description: Posted by TempletonlYou couldn\'t get a better store if you tried. It\'s full of cool things to wear, to put in your house, and to use. Terra Vida is the place to be!

properties.name: Portland
properties.description: Posted by TempletonlI\'ve never been to Portland, but I will surely be going there sometime soon. I imagine it as a place full of flowers and huge trees that canopy the streets and walking paths. You can get fresh-fruit smoothies on every corner and the best coffee that could be had. No, I\'ve never been to Portland but if I was asked to move there tomorrow I would do it in a heartbeat.

properties.name: Portland: City in my Dreams
properties.description: Posted by TempletonlI\'ve never been to Portland, but I will surely be going there sometime soon. I imagine it as a place full of flowers and huge trees that canopy the streets and walking paths. You can get fresh-fruit smoothies on every corner and the best coffee that could be had. No, I\'ve never been to Portland but if I was asked to move there tomorrow I would do it in a heartbeat.

properties.name: Sanibel Island
properties.description: Posted by TempletonlFor 23 years my Christmases were spent on the beach at Sanibel Island - a small island that is mainly home to retired snowbirds who fly south for the winter. I\'ve never seen snow on Christmas, although it did frost one year when I was in elementary school. People thinks it\'s crazy that I spend Christmas at the pool, and I suppose for Indiana Hoosiers it may seem a bit backwards, but Christmas just wouldn\'t be Christmas without the smell of tanning oil permeating through my nose, sunglasses on my face, and a good book in my hands.

properties.name: Senior Year
properties.description: Posted by TempletonlOh the good times we girls had in this house.

properties.name: Stafford
properties.description: Posted by TempletonlMy first Christmas away from home was spent, not in downtown London, but in Stafford, in the outskirts of London. properties.name: YWAM Elm Springs
properties.description: Posted by TempletonlMy Gap Year after high school was spent in a variety of places, but my ho me base became Arkansas - a place I woul never have thought would be called "my home." During my year there I learned incredible things about the God who created us and experienced challenges that helped me to grow in my spiritual faith, preparing me for the future which God has laid out for me. But one thing that sticks out most in my mind is dancing on the hay bails. You just can\'t have that kind of fun in the city!
